title: From Contextual Data to Newsvendor Decisions: On the Actual Performance of Data-Driven Algorithms. (arXiv:2302.08424v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: In this work, we explore a framework for contextual decision-making to study how the relevance and quantity of past data affects the performance of a data-driven policy. We analyze a contextual Newsvendor problem in which a decision-maker needs to trade-off between an underage and an overage cost in the face of uncertain demand. We consider a setting in which past demands observed under ``close by'' contexts come from close by distributions and analyze the performance of data-driven algorithms through a notion of context-dependent worst-case expected regret. We analyze the broad class of Weighted Empirical Risk Minimization (WERM) policies which weigh past data according to their similarity in the contextual space. This class includes classical policies such as ERM, k-Nearest Neighbors and kernel-based policies. translated_abstract: 本文探讨了一种上下文决策框架，以研究过去数据的相关性和数量如何影响数据驱动策略的性能。我们分析了一种上下文新闻供应商问题，即在面对不确定需求时，决策者需要在未满足需求和过度供应之间做出权衡。我们考虑了一种情况，在这种情况下，观察到的过去需求来自附近分布，分析了依据上下文空间中相似性权衡过去数据的加权经验风险最小化（WERM）策略的性能。这个类别包括经典的策略，如ERM、k-最近邻和基于核的策略。我们的主要方法论贡献是精确地表征了任何WERM策略在任何给定上下文配置下最坏情况下遗憾的情况。据我们所知，我们是第一个在强上下文的下界下完全表征所有WERM策略性能的人。
tldr: 本文研究数据驱动策略在上下文决策框架下的表现，给出了一类加权经验风险最小化策略在任何给定上下文配置下最坏情况下遗憾的表征，并将其应用于上下文新闻供应商问题的决策中进行实验。
en_tdlr: This paper studies the performance of data-driven policies in a contextual decision-making framework, characterizing the worst-case regret of a class of Weighted Empirical Risk Minimization (WERM) policies on any given context configuration. The WERM policies are applied to a contextual Newsvendor problem and compared experimentally.
